name: bmc-discovery
label: BMC Discovery
description: BMC Discovery is a data center discovery solution that automatically discovers data center inventory, configuration and relationship data, and maps applications to the IT infrastructure. This connector facilitates automated operation related to run search.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: url
fields.description: The service-based URL of the BMC Discovery to which you connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.title: Username
fields.name: username
fields.description: Username of the BMC Discovery Platform that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.

fields.title: Password
fields.name: password
fields.description: Password of the BMC Discovery Platform that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified. By default, this option is set to True.

operations.title: Run Search
operations.description: Retrieves information for an search query from BMC Discovery based on the filter query and input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Filter Query
parameters.name: query
parameters.tooltip: Specify a search query to run, in BMC Discovery query language. Refer this link: https://docs.bmc.com/docs/discovery/113/using-the-query-language-788111625.html
parameters.description: Specify a search query to run, in BMC Discovery query language. Refer this link: https://docs.bmc.com/docs/discovery/113/using-the-query-language-788111625.html
parameters.placeholder: e.g. SEARCH Host WHERE os_type = 'Windows' ORDER BY name SHOW name, ram

parameters.title: Result Deleted
parameters.name: delete
parameters.tooltip:
(Optional) Controls whether the result set is deleted or not before results are returned.
Result sets are deleted automatically before the last page of results are returned, but setting this field to true on any page will delete the result set immediately.
This is an optimization to free resources if you don't plan on accessing any further pages of data. Alternatively, if set to false, automatic deletion of the result set will not happen (for this request).

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: offset
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the count of the first few records to skip while retrieving response from BMC Discovery. Note: Can only be supplied if requesting results from an existing results set (by supplying a results_id).
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the count of the first few records to skip while retrieving response from BMC Discovery. Note: Can only be supplied if requesting results from an existing results set (by supplying a results_id).

parameters.title: Results ID
parameters.name: results_id
parameters.tooltip:
(Optional) An opaque id that can be used to access a result set that has already been generated via a previous search request. Must be supplied if requesting an offset greater than 0.
Note that even if retrieving results from an existing results set, the original query must be supplied in case the result set has timed out and the query needs to be re-run.
The results_id can be found in any page of results apart from the last one.

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of records that you want this operation to fetch from BMC Discovery.
